titles.title: New Markets Tax Credit Extension Act of 2013
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend the new markets tax credit, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 6/11/2013--Introduced. New Markets Tax Credit Extension Act of 2013 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) make permanent the new markets tax credit, (2) provide for an inflation adjustment to the limitation amount for such credit after 2013, and (3) allow an offset against the alternative minimum tax (AMT) for such credit (determined with respect to qualified equity investments initially made before January 1, 2014).
